} } } Length:: 0:03 MinsWe bought this because it was the most affordable waterproof camera $134. We went on vacation with it and took some really nice, clean, HD quality video/pictures. If you go frame by frame you can see the waves water droplets coming over. At the intro page you can see my pix of a nice wave that is only 1 foot and it is breaking on the shore (just above the shin). I framed the picture and showed everyone and they said the same thing "The didn't know there were waves breaking out there." They said the waves look big and off the shore.

Reviews.Title: Save your vacation!!! DON'T buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Renee Guest
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a snorkeling vacation.... it worked fine the first day.. the second day it turned off while underwater.. one minute I was taking photos of a turtle, the next it shut off never to turn back on again. Thinking it was a fluke, I wasted a half a day going to the other side of the island to buy another one..... again, the first day it worked fine, the second day the camera just started clicking through the photos on the card. i turned it off and it kept making the clicking sound.  Turned it back on to no avail.  I called Fuji customer support and got the same response as the camera... doesn't work. I have five more days of vacation and no camera. I will never buy a Fuji product again.

Reviews.Title: my daughters dream camera
Reviews.Author: Bertha
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought for my daughter who takes hikes with her class once a week and also goes on 2 over night trips. She absolutley loves this camera, she takes pictures under water (which I think is pretty cool) and whether its hot or cold this camera takes wonderful pictures. I don't think I would buy another camera besides this one ever again. I bought a $450.00 camera that did all this stuff and her camera that was a forth of what I paid does more and takes better pics.

Reviews.Title: Died at two years
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Costco before a trip to Hawaii and used it for a week with no complaint.  Two years later I took it out for another trip, never getting it out of the box since the first week.  I took it snorkeling and it took about twenty seconds of video before making a horrible noise and displaying zoom error ( I was not using zoom at all ).  Cycled power and it came back to life for five seconds before repeating, then it died forever.Fuji informs me it will cost between $50 and $100 to fix it, plus shipping, which approaches the cost of a new camera.I have old point and shoot digital cameras that have lasted over ten years with no problem, and this shockproof, waterproof, etc. was only as good as a disposable, for one week.  And it never was dropped or had any treatment other than normal except for using the underwater capability for snorkeling.Since it broke after a year it is out of warranty, but it was only the second week of full use.I would not buy any Fujifilm camera after this experience.  Back to Olympus and Canon for me.

Reviews.Title: Camera XP Finepix is junk.
Reviews.Author: Ann Dunagan "The Mission-Minded Family"
Reviews.Content: The waterproof XP is junk.  Cannot even download memory card using Windows.  Nothing happens.  Threw camera away.  tired of screwing with it.

Reviews.Title: Great kid camera
Reviews.Author: Skubo
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for teenagers who don't take care of their stuff. Both my teenage girls went on an exchange trip to central America and needed a good camera, I wasn't about to spend hundreds of dollars on one they couldn't abuse. This camera fit the bill, they took great pic's, dropped it on the ground, in the water and it made it back.Recommend for teenagers, or people on the move.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Marcie E. Hoenes "Chessie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my last fujifilm wp camera, which broke after 7 years of hard use.  This seems to have all the features of the last one.  So far it works well in snow and rain.  The last one took great underwater pictures.  There are a large variety of settings (snow, close-up, video, with and without flash, several underwater settings etc...)  They work well in different lighting, indoors and out.  I am really pleased with this replacement.  I didn't give it 5 starts because the picture quality isn't as good as a slr camera, but very good for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Avery Mock "Avery"
Reviews.Content: I found this camera by the clearance section at Wal*Mart and i was only $109.00. so i gave it a shot, then i took it up to the register then i was amazed when the price dropped down to $57.54. so i took some HD video with it, loaded it to the computer, and unlike the other reviews it hasn't bugged out on me. overall i like the camera for what i need it for, 1080p video, a secondary slowmotion camera, because this camera can shoot HS footage at  80fps with 640x480 resolution, then it shoots at 160fps at 160x240 then 240 fps at the same resolution

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy Smith
Reviews.Content: I like how durable this camera seems to be. It is easy to use and takes great pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: All In
Reviews.Author: Cyn
Reviews.Content: The shipping was quick, the camera came with all products included in the description. I bought the camera so my boyfriend and I could use in Las Vegas. We went hiking, to concerts, and sight seeing. The camera is fantastic! We love the 360 panorama option. The quality was great, there were issues with blurry pictures indoors with low lighting - I didnt have the flash on, since it was a concert, so it is a non-issue otherwise. The camera itself had very light marks from previous use, but considering the price and quality that can easily be overlooked. It is a great camera that I always purchase (I'm a fequent offender of misplacing my belongings). Hopefully this one doesn't get misplaced! Fujifilm Finepix really are great cameras!!

Reviews.Title: love this cam so fary this is
Reviews.Author: todd
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a cam this is it, no matter what you do for the money . you cant beat it, i read all the feedback and almost didn't buy this. but i said try it. if its not what you like send it bed, but i have tried to run the battery down and two days with it 300 photos latter still full battery.. remember always let the batter run all the way down and then reload it,,, it was not dead when i got it  and o used it and then set it up to charge and within 15 min,,, it was full, and two days  and still full,,, under water good photos anything you what to do with this cam you can ,  dont let some of the post turn you off  that is crap,,, we all know some won't be as good but that because of how they use it, drop it and what to return it after they used it,  this is the BEST CAM FOR THE MONEY ,  its a 5 star and nothing less,,

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Molly
Reviews.Content: this is the second FujiFilm waterproof camera I have owned and I really like them. I would def recommend. l

Reviews.Title: It works great underwater but not 100% waterproof
Reviews.Author: David Russell "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I took some amazing underwater photos of fish in Hawaii. However, water did infiltrate the camera when I threw it to my buddy that was about 20 feet below me. I wanted him to take a picture of me jumping off Black Rock. The impact got water inside the waterproof shell.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander Padilla
Reviews.Content: I use it for snowboarding and its great. I got it for less than any of the action cams around so its great for the price.I've dropped it in the snow and in water and its fine. I wouldn't risk it diving with it though. I bought a cheap water case for it and its great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good outdoors. Bad everywhere else.
Reviews.Author: SeasonDVDer
Reviews.Content: This camera works pretty good in natural light, and obviously it's awesome that it works underwater, but what I was disappointed with was its lack of versatility. I was expecting for this camera to be my new point-and-shoot; a camera that I could use for all occasions.I quickly realized, however, that it does not have a flash capability. Only on one mode does it have a flash ("Natural" Mode) and even with that one, it either bleaches out the picture or creates an out-of-focus picture.I'm hanging on to this camera because it's definitely good for being on the beach or in the outdoors, but I went ahead and bought a Canon Rebel for good portraits and indoor shots at parties/events and of my subjects.As a painter and architecture student I need a camera I can depend on for quality photos. I have realized that this is not the camera for the job.

Reviews.Title: Excellent water resistant camera
Reviews.Author: Ana Rafaela Decoroso
Reviews.Content: Good pictures for a water resistant camera. The zoom is surprisingly good considering that the objective is inside the camera. Good quality of the inside the water pictures. A lot of features that can be programmed while taking the photos as the 360º panoramic picture option. I have it now for about 1 month and tried it in the sea and in some waterfalls proving that it really is water and shock resistant. It's my first water camera so I can't compare with others but I had other compact cameras and this doesn't seem to have a worst photo quality at all. I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, bt pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Lundgreen
Reviews.Content: Much better exterior design than my deceased telescoping lens Canon, but has somewhat disappointing features. No matter - I bought this because I have a habit of accidentally destroying cameras and phones with water.

Reviews.Title: WORKING JUST 1 YEAR _ THEN "DEAD" !
Reviews.Author: Mr. Durel Philippe
Reviews.Content: My son got one offered last year on the exact same date. (a blue one)The camera never went under water, it never fell (he always carried it around in its box with the cord around the neck).Today it started displaying "ZOOM ERROR", and it won't shoot anymore ... It's "GAME OVER", just on the day when the warranty is finishing.If it was 30 or 40$ it wouldn't be too much of a problem (although, 40$ is 40$, and you don't expect a modern device to only last for 1 year) ... BUT IT'S 140$ + more, which makes it a very expensive piece of crap.It's another toy ... a crappy camera.And so are all equipments which die after 1 year of the most careful use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: James Segebarth
Reviews.Content: Bought this as an upgrade to the XP20.  Although the new double lock on the battery/card door took some getting used to, I love the camera.  Smooth sale, fast shipping, and great product.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: NOT A WATERPROOF Camera after 7 days of snorkeling
Reviews.Author: JDM
Reviews.Content: This $200 Camera failed following a total of 7 days of snorkeling.  Fuji wanted me to send it to them for verification of the failure and an estimate of cost to repair.  I indicated that under NO circumstances would I spend another nickel on the camera and asked for a refund or a replacement.  They again said that I should send it in so I asked them to first tell me what the options would be if I sent in the camera and they verified that it had failed - they would NOT say what the options would be but offered to let me speak to the manager - the manager did not answer the transfered call (even though he had just spoken with the fuji customer representative (the manager likely was dodging the call).  In short - I can not recommend this camera or its manufacturer. They make a false claim - the camera is NOT reliably waterproof beyond a few snorkeling trips at best.  I have owned cameras for 40 years and ALL the cameras I have ever purchased still work - except this one.  I recommend that anyone planning to do snorkeling chose a different camera from a different manufacturer. Best of luck to all. I give the camera a 1 star only because ZERO was not an option.

Reviews.Title: Faulty
Reviews.Author: L. Robinson
Reviews.Content: However, the one i bought It didn't work! When battery in place, nothing happens. Poor electronics. They had no replacements to offer. Refunded my purchase price fast.  I have another one, aabout a year old, and just love it, but closure button too tight.  Need another one so i can get my first one repaired without being without.  Great shots, and great movies, especially under water.

Reviews.Title: I'm Very Pleased with Performance
Reviews.Author: Billybraveheart
Reviews.Content: I have looked over the many reviews, pro's and con's and it appears there are lots of mixed reviews. As for my own personal review, well I am very pleased with my product, lots of nice settings for various situations, it's small and compact and fits nicely in the pocket. Takes great pictures, nice video in and out of the water, yes I have had it under the water in my friends swimming pool and to date have never had any issues, it took great pictures and a lot of nice video.Although I have my Nikon D3100, this little guy accompanies me everywhere. Nice product and I am pleased with results

Reviews.Title: thiscamerasucks
Reviews.Author: naf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera specifically so we could use it on the beach.  Camera worked great for the first month or so, then died because of water damage inside the battery compartment...yea our "WATER-PROOF" camera had water damage.  So we shipped it out, and then they "PROMPTLY" (and I use the term loosely) send the replacement back to us 1 month later.  Except the "replacement" was the exact same camera; which now had a problem with the lens which was blurry and out of focus.  We sent it back in about 1 month ago and have yet to receive our replacement camera.  Worst customer service ever, and worst piece of junk ever. Don't be a cheap-ass, spend the extra money and buy a Cannon or Nikkon or Samsung.  In closing, Fujifilm sucks and the Fujifilm XP50 sucks.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever....spends all of its time at the manufacturer's
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: This stupid camera is the worst piece of crap ever.  I bought one in August and it's made two trips back to the manufacturer.  It's currently there right now because (two weeks after receiving it) their useless customer service team of 3 guys can't get their act together and do work.  It's insane; the manager promised me rush delivery on my exchange as soon as he got it.  Now, they just keep hanging up and putting me on hold without doing anything.  I paid $200 to never be able to use my camera.The reason it went to the shop?  The focus stopped working.  Also, even though it's waterproof, there was saltwater damage to the battery compartment.  Ridiculous.  Then, the replacement they sent me had the EXACT SAME PROBLEM.  It is truly a cheap, worthless camera.  Spend the extra $30 and get a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: MudGirl
Reviews.Content: We go to a dusty, muddy ATV park often. I have broken 3 cameras there due to dust & mud! I purchased this camera and have had no problems. I have never directly put it underwater but have rinsed it with bottle water & in sink to remove mud! My only con is the shoot time is a little slow!! But it has been my vacation goto camera!!

Reviews.Title: Great "Kayak Fishing" Camera
Reviews.Author: bndfind
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have two of these cameras and use them mostly while on our kayaks.  They fit nicely in a pocket in our life jackets and take really good pictures for it's compact size!  We have not submerged the camera yet so I can't attest to it's under-water capabilities.  Also, you can directly access the memory card like a hard drive from a pc through the USB cable.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: If you like to spend money to be disapointed, then buy this.......
Reviews.Author: joliemojo13
Reviews.Content: Panoramic : trickyunderwater: a joke, after the 10th use, it flooded beyong repair at  a depth of 10 feetMenu: very slow  and some redundant or uselessnight mode sucks beyond believe,so, I suggest that you add few more bucks to the ideal camera, at  the end you wont regret it....

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: wacom
Reviews.Content: My favorite camera ive ever owned. Fits in my pocket, goes in the water, and takes wonderful pictures. Could not be happier

Reviews.Title: Amazing find!
Reviews.Author: william derouanna
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy to use, small camera. it has a great panoramic feature that takes amazing pics!! def worth the money! underwater feature is so much fun! the only downfall was a slight condensation under the lens when submerged for about 45 mins. cleared up after about 10 minutes on dry land!

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT
Reviews.Author: Maurcapy
Reviews.Content: this quality is very very good, the material and the style is excelent, is confortable, IS NICE, is beautiful, and the description is correct, i recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: The single, most important criteria for any camera I was considering for purchase last month was it being waterproof. If not waterproof in a pool, then it would be useless to me. I already have several non-waterproof cameras.So this camera failed me because it is not waterproof. I have a masters in engineering, so I know how to close a slide latch, followed by another slide latch, in the proper order, which was clearly labeled on the camera. This was not an instance of user error. Based on other reviews, it was likely not just a single bad copy of the camera. Many users have reported problems with water entering the camera. The water first appeared as condensation on the back screen, then later, condensation on the lens, which renders all photos worthless at that point.The camera is allegedly waterproof to 1/2 atmosphere (15 ft), but the camera never went to even half of that depth, and it's total time spent at anything under two feet from the surface was three seconds, at a maximum depth of seven feet. The problem might be, and I'm speculating, that normal use in a pool, with the camera attached to a wrist, creates forces greater than 1/2 atmosphere, such as stroking the water to move forward, etc. Pehaps the specs are simply not sufficient to withstand normal activity at the water's surface. I don't know other than I'm taking this one back.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for Outdoors
Reviews.Author: Edward Williams
Reviews.Content: I ride a motorcycle and needed a camera that could withstand the elements and be rugged enough to handle motorcycle trips.  This camera fits that requirement.

Reviews.Title: Very poor picture quality, no manual controls
Reviews.Author: J. L. Fuhring
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera several months ago hoping to replace my very old Canon A/120 camera (that I use in the dust and rain for photography on horseback).  First, there are no manual controls so I can't set it for maximum aperture and have the camera set maximum shutter speed for conditions as I can with the old Canon.  The "sport" mode is absolutely useless for preventing blurring when I'm in motion. The "sport" mode does not calculate for maximum aperture or shutter speed and implying that this mode is useful for high speed action shooting is a cruel hoax.  Even when holding the camera perfectly still, the quality of the photographs are unacceptably poor and very noticeably inferior to my old Canon, very noticeably inferior.  This camera is a good example high pixel count being absolutely meaningless and just a sales gimmick.If you simply want low quality snapshots, I suggest you use your cell phone.  If you want shallow underwater shots and will accept poor quality images, this camera might work for you.  My very first camera was a Fuji back around 1999 and I've had other Fuji cameras I've been very happy with, but this is the worst camera Fuji has ever made with regard to picture quality -- even worse than my first 1.5 MP camera. I don't give up easily so I thought I could figure ways around some of this camera's failings.  Over the months I've tried every trick in the book, but I've run out of tricks.  I foolishly kept the camera too long to return it and now I'll have to find somebody to give it to as a gift - I sure wouldn't feel right charging money for this turkey.  By the way, yes, I took a chance and did "upgrade" the firmware (because I was so desperate to improve the images), but it didn't help the horrible picture quality one bit.  Fuji does kindly warn you that if you upgrade the firmware, it is tricky and it might not work and if it doesn't you will end up with a useless camera that is not covered by warranty.  Nice.

Reviews.Title: Worst digital camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: S. Poe
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera. Forget whether it will hold up under water -- it quite simply takes the worst photos I have ever seen. My 4 mp Canon back in 2000 took better quality photos. It is terrible.I picked it up on sale as a last minute birthday gift before a trip to Puerto Rico. Ten days of shooting left us with 90% duds and maybe 5% worth even considering. What a waste.

Reviews.Title: Great mid-priced underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Carr "cdcarresq"
Reviews.Content: I have bought several allegedly waterproof cameras and always been disappointed--until now (this was much better then the panasonic lumix I bought last year, see below). I'm shocked that it's averaging about 3 stars.  I can only assume some purchasers were expecting way too much.  It's a point and shoot that works under water.  It takes good pictures and keeps the water out.  I do have to agree with one other reviewer that-surprisingly-sand seems to get caught up inside the latches and buttons a bit, but it does NOT get inside the camera, so I can't really consider that a fault.I took this on a cruise and basically wore the thing around my neck on a lanyard for the entire week. I took pictures in the pool, the beach and snorkeling. Picture quality was extremely good. The OUT of water shots were as good as any other digital point and shoot I've used. I had NO issues with the flash as other reviewers indicated. In fact, the flash seemed very even and not concentrated in one spot which is always one of my biggest gripes with point and shoots. This would serve someone very well as a day-to-day point and shoot camera. The underwater shots were also VERY good; they were clear with good color and contrast.I charged the battery at the end of every day and never really had any problems with battery life. On a couple of occasions I couldn't get it to shoot video due to a low battery, but it always shot pictures. It was not a significant issue.Last year I bought a panasonic lumix for a beach trip and the thing leaked the first day or two causing me to lose photos too. What pictures I did have were mediocre.

Reviews.Title: Ruined my family vacation
Reviews.Author: sadie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip which was wonderful but I only have photos from the first 2 days.Great little camera till the lense fogged up with moisture I was very careful when opening it the 3 times I did,I should have paid more attention to the other reviews now I have limited photos of my children on there first trip to mexico a refund is not enough!

Reviews.Title: Cheap and Weatherproof, but average or below in every other way.
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera, mainly in video mode, to record various outdoor sporting events.Pros:- It's small, light, and easily fits into any pocket.- Bright colors to keep it from getting lost- Starts up fast to catch quick shots- Simple menu structure to keep things easy.Cons:- Lens is very soft. It may be high megapixels, but a lot of those are left useless from the soft pictures it takes. Some mild sharpening in software does help tremendously.- Audio/Video sync issues. The audio is offset from the video by approx. 80ms. For most things this isn't too bad, but in certain situations this is bad.- Uses an odd codec for audio preventing it from being edited directly in Adobe Premiere. Must extract the audio via Quicktime Pro prior to editing- Focus isn't fast enough to keep up with zoom in video (focus is lost during zoom).- Not lens dust cover means, well, dust on the lens.- Infrequently, the audio will be "buzzy". A power cycle will correct this.- White balance is all over the place when panning. The image can go from a slight red hue to green depending on lighting.- Image stabilization is turned OFF when in video mode.- Suffers from CMOS rolling shutterWhile overall the camera still fits my original goal of something cheap that I wouldn't be too heartbroken about damaging, weatherproof, and 1080p 30fps video, I wonder if my money could have been better spent on a nicer camera and save me time later trying to correct image problems.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP50
Reviews.Author: Andrew J Alvarez N
Reviews.Content: La Fujifilm FinePix XP50 es una muy buena camara, con un agradable diseño que aguanta maltratos por un muy bajo precio!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP50 Digital Camera (Blue) (Electronics)
Reviews.Author: X-mas Mom
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to buy another waterproof camera after my first experience with another brand that was not very waterproof.  I wanted something that was sturdy and user friendly for my 8 year old.  She loves it and has been able to take underwater pictures and it has stood up to the outdoors, water and even the cold.  The picture quality is great and I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: buzz_review
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hoping I'd be able to take some underwater pictures. I made sure I followed all the instructions for securing the battery compartment and making sure it's all dry and dustless. Well, it worked for about an hour, then it started showing error messages. Then it stopped working all together. Water got inside and it seemed completely soaked. Customer service told me it'd take about a month to do "repairs" and I'd have to pay to ship it to them. Worthless. I made a very bad choice! Wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Practica
Reviews.Author: gdpcordoba
Reviews.Content: Una camara ideal para las fotos espontaneas en todos los climas, ademas saca muy buenas fotos de atardeceres. Sumergible al 100 por 100

Reviews.Title: Nice camera when/if it works
Reviews.Author: Monte Shaffer "mshaffer"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at a BIG BOX store, thinking the shock-resistance would be nice since the last camera I had broke when dropped.  I bought the black version.The two-stage open/close compartment is very weird, and sometimes would cause the camera to not function very well, or not turn on.  The camera worked great on my trip to Paris with my girlfriend.  Hi-resolution is nice.  Once or twice it didn't seem to turn on right away, or we had to adjust something for it to turn on.  Also, the HD video is very nice, but the downside is it drains the battery very rapidly.I needed the camera to take pictures of students in my marketing course today, charged the battery fully, inserted it into the camera, and the machine would not power on.  ANY IDEAS on WHY?14 megapixels is great WHEN the camera works.  I feel like the engineers have failed miserably at the power-consumption issues.I have NOT tried taking photos underwater.

Reviews.Title: The disclaimers are so ridiculous why bother?
Reviews.Author: kittyhead
Reviews.Content: I bought it last night before reading any of the reviews.  Brought it home read manual and was disgustingly laughing so much I wanted to take it back before taking any pictures.  The camera is suppose to be water,shock,freeze,dust proof, but there are so many disclaimers there really isn't any guarantee the thing will even take pictures.  The humor continues while you read a page of warnings about how the thing will shock you or cause fire if you look at it wrong.Ok enough ranting about the Manual.I decided to give it a try.  So today I took some pictures.  Sorry guys, my ancient day Canon powershot A560 is better.  I would still be using it but the lame design of the latch and the fact the the rubberbands no longer work, I find I need sometime new.Of course the Canon picture quality is much better than this Fuji.Low light is really bad on this Fuji.  I know it's an issue with most cameras, from the reviews I've read, but I thought it would be decent.The Fuji took a lot longer to focus.The sound wasn't as good or strong.The video had that soft focus blur thing that I think is a preference choice. I don't like it.That's about it.  I didn't even bother with the water, what was the point, especially with all the disclaimers. (It's a water proof camera that the manual says not to set on wet surface)?

Reviews.Title: Fuji camera
Reviews.Author: patty
Reviews.Content: My daughter just loved this camera for christmas this year.  She reallly can't wait to use it underwater in the summer.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: My son loves this camera. He took numerous pictures Christmas morning! It takes wonderful pictures and very durable. The color is a wonderful green!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP50 digital camera (Silver)
Reviews.Author: Robert Schorejs
Reviews.Content: I have only taken a few photos, on land, but I will try photos in saltwater, very soon. So far,so good !

Reviews.Title: Took great pictures until it met water...
Reviews.Author: T. Atherton "t_bill"
Reviews.Content: I have an older Fuji XP that I have had for a few years.  It worked great and I had taken it snorkeling a couple of times.  I upgraded to the XP50 for the HD video and higher quality photos on the recommendation of a photographer friend of mine who said for the quality of the pictures at this price point it could not be beat.I took the new XP50 on my recent cruise to the Bahamas.  It was working great, taking great photos and video until I took it snorkeling off Nassau.  As soon as it hit water the rear screen leaked and the camera failed.  Fortunately the battery and SD card compartment did not leak and my photos, etc. were not lost.  I am sure this was just a defect in this camera as my other Fuji still works fine, but Fuji definitely needs to up their quality control if they are going to be marketing these cameras as waterproof and shockproof!

Reviews.Title: AF issues and poor image quality are dealbreakers...
Reviews.Author: JAB "JAB"
Reviews.Content: I knew this wasn't going to be a superstar camera when I bought it however I've got an old Canon A720IS that produces MUCH better pictures than this camera does.Pros:  Cheap, water resistant, depending on where you buy it from it sometimes comes bundled with a buoyant strap,cheap, takes videoCons:  Autofocus is very unreliable. Most shots are quite back-focused, Poor resolution (I'd says it's probably equivalent to a 4megapixel camera.  The image files are large but resolution is poor due to oppressive noise reduction that obliterates most of the detail (EVEN AT ISO100).With my six year old powershot, I did see this IF I was using ISO800 but when I shot at ISO100 my files looked pretty clean.Videos even appear quite noisy (even after the resolution is reduced by ~7x).

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: dyshorse
Reviews.Content: I owned another fuji similar to this one, it went on alot of trips. videoed unterwater as well as above the water.

Reviews.Title: fugifilm fine pix XP 50 Digital Camera [blue]
Reviews.Author: P. Justice
Reviews.Content: The camera would not work but the company sent me a  form to ship it back with very quickly....I would purchase from this company, Beach Camera. again without hesitation.....I have a friend who has used this camera and it is a great camera.......I just happened to get one with a problem....which happens to everyone now and then......I purchased another camera locally since I needed one for photos now....family here for the holidays. The fugi tha I purchashed as a replacement is a great camera....

Reviews.Title: 5★
Reviews.Author: carolyn
Reviews.Content: Great camera, I found it very easy to use my 3 year old allowed me to find out on our trip to the beach that it is indeed dust and water proof I would definatly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Get little camera to carry with you
Reviews.Author: Karie Cook "cookie kar"
Reviews.Content: It takes wonderful pictures, it's easy to carry, it's waterproof, and it's easy to use. Love this camera, short of getting an expensive camera this is the best point and shoot digital camera I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: A good general use camera
Reviews.Author: Anime Collector "Yojimbo_2000"
Reviews.Content: I had an XP10 which would not turn-on anymore.  The new XP50 is easy to use and takes decent picture in the daylight.  The nighttime and indoor pictures are ok but nothing spectacular compared to my wife Canon.  I got the XP50 for outdoor use especially the water.

Reviews.Title: Fuji XOP 150 review
Reviews.Author: Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Have really put this camera through its paces, from still photos of subjects in motion, indoors, outdoors, etc.  The full HD video is great and so easy to switch between still and video, unlike many other cameras that require a detailed menu search, the Fuji has a button on the back that when pressed starts the video record.  Press again and the video record stops, and you are back in photo mode.  I have not had the opportunity to try this underwater yet, but if it works as well as it has so far it will also be great.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Anita M. Lemmon "A Lemmon"
Reviews.Content: This camera was great.  I was at a once in a lifetime football game (Pittsburgh Steelers) and it rained  the entire game.  But have no fear...my camera was Waterproof!  So happy I bought it!

Reviews.Title: only buy it if there is a good refund policy
Reviews.Author: dcoop
Reviews.Content: We bought our camera at costco in hawaii. It worked great for a week.... we snorkeled 5x and used it everytime. Also used it when we went inner tubing. Even lost it in the ocean and found it 10 minutes later! It worked great for the entire week but now, at home, the video function doesnt work. Good thing we bought it at costco. I will be returning it and will wait to buy another underwater camera when we go on vacation.The pics and video we took on vacation turned out great. I liked having it as a back up camera to take to the beach rather than risk getting sand or water in my nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: michael galagher
Reviews.Content: My father lent me this camera for my honeymoon trip. He had just got it, and never used it. I was so excited to try it. Tested it in the pool worked fine. Took it snorkeling to shoot sea turtles. Appeared to work great, until it said the memory is full. Turned it off, an hour later turned it on and the display screen would not work. Tried it a few more times, but same problem. Of course I look up the reviews, and shocking everyone else had a similar problems. Biggest shocker is he took it back to the store, and they had to send it out for repairs. Was also shocked to find out that the sales rep. Had recommended the product. Luckily I was able to get the pictures off the camera by putting the memory card in another camera (a canon that is 8yrs old been through hell and still works) long story short save your cash, and do your own research. More examples of companies after money, than customers.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: tim_me
Reviews.Content: This is my second Fuji, The XP20 was my first underwater camera and was dropped onto concrete from over 6ft... it did't survive. I then tried another brand and was frustrated with it. I now own the XP50 and love the pictures with the exception of low lite (also an issue with my XP20) The video is fantastic. Very responsive, from turn on to picture is very short. The only issue I have with this camera is on day 31, we were hiking and my daughter had the camera and banged it against a rock while on a steep incline. this knocked the focus mechanism out of alignment and has rendered the camera inoperative. I am going to contact Fuji in hopes that they will replace under warranty as this was not a drop, but a bump... I'll let you know how I make out!!!Fujifilm FinePix XP50 Digital Camera (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bryon R. Czaja
Reviews.Content: My husband (his account) and I love this camera!  He got it for me as a wedding gift.  We just went on our honeymoon, and I finally tried out the waterproof feature.  I was so nervous, but then two people at the pool vouched for their camera (same kind) handling the water just fine, so I submerged it to take some pictures.  The pictures came out great!  It works just fine!  No problems.I think aside from being able to use it in the pool, my favorite feature is the function that allows you two pictures at once, one with flash, and one without.  It's a great feature!The battery lasts pretty long if I charge it overnight and don't leave it on when I'm not snapping pictures (it died at alcatraz because I kept it on, not wanting to miss a thing.)It was really easy for me to figure out too!Long story short, it's a great camera!  I love it!  He loves it! It's a great camera, I would definitely recommend it!And if you know someone who's getting married and they'll be near water on their honeymoon (pool, cruise, island etc.) it makes an amazing gift!!I can't wait to use it at the Dells!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for beach, surf and snorkeling use.
Reviews.Author: Brooks
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my girlfriend after the compartment doors her last waterproof camera (kodak sport) became extremely difficult to open and close. We took it on a 2 week adventure to Puerto Rico, St. Thomas and St. John. After snorkeling, surfing and playing in the sand nearly everyday the camera still works great, but as with other waterproof cameras we have had the compartment door is beginning to become more difficult to open and close. The pictures and video all turned out great. The menu is a bit complicated, and battery life is a little short, but the performance remains outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Design & Quality
Reviews.Author: picture pixy
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for less than a year and it has been broken twice!  That means its been to Fujifilm's repair center in NJ twice!  I would not recommend anyone buy the camera - the door to the battery & memory stick compartment is a bad design & is difficult to close/lock.  While skiing we took this camera and the door came open & the battery fell out (unbeknown to us) so we captured memories from half of our ski trip.  The other repair that was needed, was after taking the camera to the water park, water got into the lens & it stopped working...this is supposed to be a waterproof camera!  Insult to injury...dealing with Fujifilm's customer service has also been a complete disappointment and waste of time.  My recommendation?  DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater and point and shoot camera if you know what you are doing, not recommended for novices.
Reviews.Author: Gordon K. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Target for around $120 on sale to take with me on vacation to Maui, and it worked just fine both above and below the water.  It is just a point and shoot camera, but I found it to be pretty amazing.  I took it snorkeling and took pretty good photos and HD videos with it, the other thing I really liked about it besides being waterproof was the panorama feature, where you could take 120 degree, 180 degree, or 360 degree shots and the camera would stitch them together for you.  I was actually pretty blown away by this camera, you can see some of the shots and videos I took at my family vacation blog here: [...]  (Be warned: they are mainly boring vacation photos, also some were from my IPhone,and some from my Fujifilm Finepix S100FS, but the video and underwater and panoramic ones are from the XP50.)The only downside that I found with this camera was that the video had a hard time auto focusing when zooming and the sound quality isn't very good, but for around $120 I'm very pleased with the Fujifilm FinePix XP50!The reason the I would not recommend this camera for novices is because it is a sensitive electronic device and IF YOU ARE CARELESS WITH IT YOU WILL BREAK IT. I.E. it can only go down to five meters or around 15 feet, so probably not good for scuba diving.  It isn't supposed to be submerged for over 2 hours at one time.  It has a special opening and closing locking sequence to the battery and memory compartment. So if you are not careful in following all these rules you will wreck the camera.  This doesn't make it a bad camera, it just means that you are a novice photographer and should probably get something simpler and more indestructible.  Peace out, happy shooting!

Reviews.Title: Two Major Flaws
Reviews.Author: Ninja Emery
Reviews.Content: First, the battery compartment door began to be difficult to open. Then it became impossible to open. Trying to open it, I left three tiny marks on the door. And I do mean tiny - they were not 'pry marks'. Anyhow, we sent it in to Fuji as it was still, at two weeks old, well under warranty.Second, the company refused to fix it because of the 'pry marks'. No notice was taken of the fact that the door was faulty or of poor design in the first place. To whit, they weaseled out of their own warranty.Emery C. Walters, author of As I Am, Out is In, and others.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned within 30 minutes
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I didn't have a chance to read any Amazon reviews before I purchased this model from a local discount retailer...but, like the vast majority of other reviewers, I experienced the same consistant characteristics; locked up within 30 minutes of using it, wouldn't go into shooting mode, buttons unresponsive, etc.This was really disappointing since I'd had another Fuji model (Z33WP) that went to hell and back until it finally sprang a leak.As much as I'd like to remain a Fuji fan...it's on to another brand.Save yourself the trouble...avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: Finepix XP50
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Great outdoor camera.  Took this on vacation with us to Niagara Falls.  We were able to take nice photos and video on the tour "under" the falls.  Also came in handy for hiking in a light rain.  Shooting video is a HUGE drain on battery ... beware.

Reviews.Title: Waterpoof??  Really?
Reviews.Author: CDFFiremedic
Reviews.Content: We just bought this as an inexpensive waterproof camera for a trip to cancun...worked "decent" for the first day or so, took about 10 pictures underwater of sharks, rays, etc that all looked like junk.  Next day took a trip to Akumal to snorkel with sea turtles..one of the greatest experiences ever...would even be better if I could have tank a picture of them.  The camera failed while strapped to my wrist in 4' of water.  Thankfully, the SD card was fine and I got to pull my Ila Mujeres pics off...as far a sthe sea turtles..I guess Ill have to come back with a camera that works.  Don't buy this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Three cameras failed
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately made the mistake of buying this camera for my mother and two daughters.  My mothers camera door was broken when we took it out of the box.  She thought it was to complicated so I returned it a bought another brand.  I should have returned the other two.  My youngest daughter loved using it it the pool with friends until the battery compartment door opened on its own.  I let the camera dry and used rice to absorb moisture.  It never worked again.  The worst part is that it's not even six months old.  My older daughter lives in St. Thomas so we wanted something water proof.  Her camera has the same issue with the Battery compartment door not staying closed.  The biggest problem is That I cannot get anyone to tell me how to return them.  I would not suggest this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: iPhone takes better pictures - Will be returning camera
Reviews.Author: Don_Drapper
Reviews.Content: I got this camera at a big box store for $150.  Didn't think it could bee to bad.  Last digital camera I got was in 2005 and that camera out does this one.  This camera is pretty crappy.Pros: Usable under water, Shock proof, and takes decent videosCons: Sucks at taking pictures - Pictures are VERY grainy.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working the second it touched water
Reviews.Author: Ariel
Reviews.Content: This is my first review ever but I was so bummed with this camera I wanted to warn others.I bought this camera before a trip to Panama expecting to be able to take some cool underwater pics. It worked fine for a few days while taking pictures of the city. We went to the beach and I made sure the latch was sealed and took one photo underwater (less than a foot deep ) when it stopped working. The screen went black and hasn't turned on since.The camera never touched the sand and was in my bag the whole time until I went into the water. I'm going to see about getting my money backWould not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics and Value.
Reviews.Author: DJ Swin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on closeout from Costco last summer right before we left for the lake. I figured why not, we may be able to get a few good pics from it that we wouldn't take with a non-waterproof. Even though I have a much nicer Canon T3i with a nice Tamron lens, i ended up using this little camera for all(most) of my summer lake and beach photos. The colors are  ice and if you have a good photo software program (I use Aperture) to tidy pics up a bit, you can have some pretty good results. I don't think this specific model is offered anymore, but the most recent version of this is still probably a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Leaked the second time we used it!
Reviews.Author: Carol Burgert
Reviews.Content: We used it once and were very careful about making sure it was closed correctly but it leaked the second time we used it.  We were very disappointed in it.

Reviews.Title: Won't work well every time
Reviews.Author: picture girl
Reviews.Content: After several Fuji cameras, and being very pleased with them. I bought it for water use - not underwater - just around water.Some of the pix are clear, some are too blurry to see what the subject is, some are 'washed out' colors. I gave it 2 (TWO) STARS because the shot/recovery time was in an ok range. The battery gave me no problems but I have a spare just in case. With the loss of some shots due to part-time working lenses, I have lost good photos of scenes and friends, like all of you have when it fails. I would not recommend this camera and very sorry I bought it. I'll go for another manufacturer for my next waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: He Loved It
Reviews.Author: tom mangels
Reviews.Content: This is what my Nephew wanted for cxmas and he started playing with it that night.It should last a while with him.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: CupcakeCookie
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera!! It does everything from face defection, to black and white mode!!!! I got it for Christmas and I am sooooooooo happy!! Buy this camera right now, you will not regret it!! Don't listen to the terrible comments!! This camera is fantastic for the price :)

Reviews.Title: Dynamic Range fails
Reviews.Author: Ali Roustai
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hopeing it would perform better than the Olympus tg-820 but I am also disappointed in this one, so it's going back.Pros.- light- good video quality with better focus and detail than the Olympus counterpart but not as good as the Sony point and shoot- priced well- better detail than the Olympus in the pictures.Cons:Macro does not work well in zoom modeDynamic range is terrible. As the shades and the greys look black and it's not easy to fix with.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware: I've seen better images from disposable cameras
Reviews.Author: Shannon W. Mack
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and returned it after only one day of use. Photos are inferior in quality to my five-year-old Canon Digital Elph. It also loses focus while zooming during video recording. I didn't keep the thing long enough to determine if the "water proof" qualities were faulty as some other reviews have suggested. Pictures taken in automatic mode are either blurry or over-exposed. This is not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Took it back after one week
Reviews.Author: SE Michigan Guy
Reviews.Content: I saw this camera at a big box store for only $139 after in store rebate of $40.  Every picture I took was blurry.  Videos would not focus when zooming.  No problems returning it.

Reviews.Title: Bad pics even under optimum conditions
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I tested it outside wearing all neutral clothing - no blacks or whites. The sun was in back of the camera. Grass with trees in the background.  There wasn't a single inch of black or white to mess up the auto exposure.  Within an hour I took stills and movies, on auto, in shade, bright shade and full sun. I took stills both with and without the flash.Despite the optimum exposure set up, the XP50 failed to deliver more than a few properly exposed stills or frames.  Even though everything was neutral, photos had large areas of complete black or white wash out.  When the flash was used, it took the camera off automatic and delivered a completely washed out picture. Even dark colors were totally whited out by the flash.  Near white and lighter colors washed out completely even without the flash.The all inclusive automatic functions are all or nothing.  Make one manual and they all become manual. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Is this even a camera?
Reviews.Author: Ana Chang
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when I bought this camera. I go snorkeling every year and always wanted one, but didn't want to mess with the underwater casings. Bought mine at Costco at a good price, tried taking a few photos. Maybe there's some inconsistencies with the sensors, because some reviewers say they got great photos. My photos were either grainy or blurry, even under good light conditions. Really, REALLY grainy.  It may be a whole lot of megapixels, but what good is it when the sensor is recording giant blotches of color instead of any detail? I was about 15 feet away from the subject, and you can't even actually make out any features on the face, just blobs. And when the sun hits the camera, the hard cover on the lens creates a lot of lens flare that obliterates half of your photo. Thankfully Costco has a great return policy; it's going back.

Reviews.Title: Good for the beach but not perfect.
Reviews.Author: Mike C "Mike C"
Reviews.Content: I had the original for a few years and it died one day in the water.  I had a gift card so I only paid 40 bucks for this one.  You can tell its cheaply made and has low quality firmware.  I didn't notice any warranty info anywhere on the box or papers. I use it surfing so I don't expect much as its a tough environment.  Pics and videos are decent. Just be sure to get it on sale and be happy if it lasts over a year with water use and sand.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA! RUINED MY HONEYMOON
Reviews.Author: Dozer
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! DONT DO IT!I just got back from my honeymoon from Mexico. I was looking for a good waterproof camera to take simple pictures of us snorkeling and us in the ocean. I was already skeptical of this product but hey, its waterproof! So I made sure it was locked up and went snorkeling, let me tell you, I didnt go deep at all..i was tredding water  in the snorkeling equipment and after the 2nd picture in the water the screen went black!When i got back on the boat and dried off the camera, I opened up the waterproof compartment and what came out of the area thats not supposed to get water in it? WATER! LOTS AND LOTS OF WATER!Do not buy this piece of junk.Thank god i had a real name brand camera that saved my trip,Save your money, I beg you do not let this happen to you.
